intro: Aylostera leucacantha, commonly known as the white-stemmed aylostera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Aylostera leucacantha is often found in humid, mountainous environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
